Bell  Carlson Carbelite Stock ($160) - Olive w  Black Web Bell and Carlson stocks are reliable over a temperature range of -50F to + 140F and all stocks are covered by a limited lifetime warranty. Besides being impervious to weather, having the benefits of strength, and the reduction of felt recoil, Bell and Carlson stocks are built to look and feel like a wood stock with which all shooters are familiar.  Bushnell Trophy Riflescope 3-9x40 Multi-X Reticle, Matte Finish ($150) - This scope features Amber Bright multi-coated optics for low light hunting situations, a rugged one-piece tube design, 100% waterproof fog-proof shockproof construction, dry-nitrogen filled , 1 4 M.O.A. fingertip, audible   resettable windage and elevation adjustment, and a fast-focus eyepiece.  Leather Sling ($20) -  Leather sling, hooks are heavy solid brass, nicely polished and riveted to the leather. All faithful to the original 1907 sling.  Harris Bipod ($110) - 6-9 Mounts to QD swivel studs on bolt action and single-shot rifles for ultimate field accuracy. Wont change zero; added weight steadies gun. Spring-loaded, telescoping legs adjust quickly, fold parallel to barrel for carrying. Series S bipods rotate 45 for instant leveling on uneven ground. Buffer springs and adjustable tension on hinged base help eliminate tremor.  All Metal parts coated with Robar POLYMAX ($225) which gives the following advantages:   Chemical Resistant   Water Resistant   Excellent Adhesion   Mar  Abrasion Resistant   Excellent Hardness   Excellent Impact Resistance   View attachment 338362       View attachment 338363        Looking for an AR-15 plus cash on my end.

HK now offers the long awaited civilian variant of the popular 416 upper. This MR556, match grade upper receiver assembly comes complete and ready to pin onto any standard AR-15 lower receiver. The short stroke gas piston design ensures cooler, cleaner operation of this upper for reliabilty and less time scrubbing residue out of the receiver after extended shooting sessions. Upper Receiver: MR556 Flat-Top Barrel Length: 16.5 Barrel Contour: Heavy Barrel Material: Hammer Forged Chrome Moly Steel Muzzle Thread Pattern: 1 2-28 Chrome Lined: No Barrel Finish: Parkerized Twist Rate: 1 in 7 Chamber: 5.56x45mm NATO M4 Feed Ramps: Yes Muzzle Device: A2 flash hider Gas System Length: Carbine, short stroke gas piston Gas Block Diameter: 0.750 Handguard: 9 Free Float Quad Rail  As for trades Im open to glocks,ARs,1911s something cool

RARE Pivoting Grip Pod             They were imported from Israel  Only a few hundred sold before being sent back by Customs. These were never supposed to be exported to the USA.        Made from high-density polymer, offers a comfortable and secure grasp with its 4 finger grooves. Pushbutton instantaneously releases the bipod. The bipod legs are reinforced with a 1.2mm steel insert for extra strength and are serrated for improved gripping.         The Pivoting Pod Grip has all the features of the Pod Grip, plus it can pivot 60-degrees off center in both directions for a total of 120-degrees and the legs auto-center for immediate repositioning of the weapon. It also cants 30 degrees on the vertical axis for use on uneven surfaces.         Securely attach to any Picatinny rail with a spring loaded clamping mechanism that tightens with a thumbnut.             NO PAYPAL or CC        USPS $$$ ORDER ONLY for FASTEST TURNAROUND          David@ 21st Century Weapons        FFL SOT Since 1998

Hate to let her go, but I have never fired it and its just sitting in a dark safe. Here is the exact description when I bought it. Smith  Wesson Model 28-2 .357 Highway Patrolman thats been improved over factory. This revolver wears the 4  pinned  barrel and has the  recessed (counter-bored) chambers. This revolver received an action job by Teddy Jacobson (Actions by T) and is marked with his logo on the right side of the frame. Jacobsons crane ball lock has also been installed to help keep things tight and the trigger face has been smoothed. Overall condition is excellent with about 97-98% finish remaining. There are a few minor handling marks and the usual cylinder turn line, but no rust or any pitting. The custom grips are reminiscent of the old SW diamond Magnas, but the are actually ebony wood and there is a grip adapter installed for a vintage look and improved purchase. Over 450.00 in custom work. The mechanics are in good working order and both timing and lock-up are excellent. The bore is likewise in excellent shape with bright sharp rifling, this Smith was manufactured in about 1971. Meet in Loganville, Grayson, Monroe, Walnut Grove or Covington. Trades, maybe....colt 1911, other smith and Wessons. HERE THE LINK to TEDDYs website:       http:  www.actionsbyt.com
